awd_abstract_narration: The long-term goal of this work is to develop and evaluate                      auditory representations of multidimensional data.  For some                    forms of data (e.g., time series) auditory displays may be                      especially well suited to human perceptual analysis and possibly                much more effective than current visual displays.  Auditory data                representation is fundamentally a mapping from a data variable to               a property of a sonic event.  Where the variable is                             multidimensional, the measure on each dimension of the data                     sample determines the value of the corresponding sound property                 of the event, and the values of all the measures together                       determine the overall character of the event.  For example, if                  the event is a simple tone, one data dimension could be mapped to               pitch, another to loudness, and a third to duration.  A variety                 of auditory displays can be created depending on the kind of data               and the kind of analysis to be conducted.  Research in auditory                 data representation has been severely hampered by the lack of an                appropriate computing environment.  The Principal Investigators                 are building a prototype computing environment for research in                  auditory data representation and, using this environment, to                    develop several different auditory data representations and to                  conduct preliminary evaluations of these auditory data                          representations with both real and synthetic data.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
